page.title: 13Singleton Open Air Museum
page.content: The museum provides a different and enjoyable way of learning about the Past.On its site,it has 40 buildings of historical interest,as well as nature walks,farms and a medieval market. The museum was formed in 1969,by Roy Armstrong,and is owned by West Dean. All the houses are brought to the site in pieces and reassembled in their original condition.As a last resort ,replicas are sometimes used. There is an operational water mill_a wind pump is used to circulate the water. To sustain the museum,Â£250,000,which is the average annual income,is needed every year. Some of the buildings have been moved several times,and one was completely destroyed by arson.
